job_description:
Up to $50/hr + Sign-on bonus, Overtime  On-siteMatches your job preferences, workplace type is On-site.
  Full-time
51-200 employees
Skills: Aircraft Maintenance, Aircraft, +8 more
See how you compare to 21 applicants. Try Premium for $0 Primary description: Wichita, KS · 2 months ago · 21 applicants As an A&P Mechanic at Yingling Aviation, you will maintain, repair, and overhaul aircraft to ensure the aircraft is in safe working condition.




$2,500 sign-on bonus after 90 days of employment!




Responsibilities

Perform all repairs, replacements, etc. on all aircraft systems, airframes, or engines in a safe and expeditious manner and within FAA, and or manufacturer’s specifications.
Assist team leaders and shop foreman in finding unsafe or potential problems to customer’s aircraft. Report errors, and do repair as needed.
Become familiar with all technical publications (maintenance manuals, parts catalogs, airworthiness directives, service bulletins, etc.) concerning aircraft maintained at this facility.
Own and maintain basic hand tools and test equipment to perform assigned tasks.
Work and communicate closely with other shop and office personnel to assure smooth transition of all customer aircraft.
Become familiar and proficient with all shop test and maintenance gear.
Perform all tasks assigned by management in a timely and safe manner.
Maintain a professional demeanor towards all customers, be courteous, informative and sincere.
Maintain a clean and neat work area. Help with other housekeeping duties as assigned.
Provide backup to line personnel when they are moving aircraft in and out of the hangers.
Other activities and projects as approved by the Director of Maintenance, Shop Foreman or the General Manager.




Qualifications

A&P License required
Inspection Authorization License preferred
3+ years in aircraft maintenance required.
Experience with Cessna and Beechcraft models.
Must possess and maintain a current and valid license.
Meet the requirements of Airport Authority to be receive a badge and have no ramp restrictions
Must be able to read and speak English.
Must be able to communicate effectively with other personnel.




Equal Opportunities

Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.

Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.

This employer uses E-Verify.
